name: Potstickers
description: These potstickers are a delicious and easy appetizer or meal. I usually make a lot and then freeze them for later.
instructions: In a bowl, mix together the meat, cabbage, ginger, garlic, scallion whites, and 2 tablespoons of soy sauce with ¼ cup of water. Lay a dumpling wrapper on a clean, dry surface. Using your finger or a brush, lightly coat half of the wrapper’s edge with egg wash. Place about a rounded teaspoon of the filling in the center, then fold the wrapper over and press the edges together to seal. Be careful not to overfill. Arrange the dumplings on a plate, covering them with plastic wrap if you plan to refrigerate for a few hours or freeze them (for up to two weeks).

Heat about 2 tablespoons of oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. After a minute, add the dumplings one by one. They can touch but should lie flat in a single layer. Cook for around 2 minutes, or until the bottoms are lightly browned and the oil is mostly absorbed. Pour ¼ cup of water into the pan for every dozen dumplings and cover. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer for about 3 minutes.
For the dipping sauce, mix together the remaining soy sauce, the green parts of the scallions, and vinegar.

Uncover the dumplings, increase the heat to medium-high, and cook for another 1 to 2 minutes until the bottoms are dark brown and crispy, and the water has evaporated. (Add more oil if needed.) Serve hot with the dipping sauce.

ingredients.name: Meat
ingredients.notes: you can use ground pork/beef, minced mushroom, or even a combo of both

ingredients.name: Scallion
ingredients.preparation: white and green parts separated and minced

ingredients.name: Sesame oil
ingredients.notes: can also use vegetable oil or peanut oil
